title: Advances in Planar Lipid Bilayers and Liposomes Vol. 18
description:
Advances in Planar Lipid Bilayers and Liposomes Vol. 18 (Elsevier, 2013).pdf

ISBN 9780124115156

Volume 18 of Advances in Planar Lipid Bilayers and Liposomes (APLBL) includes nine chapters mainly devoted to the practical advancements and applications of lipid nanostructures. The volume starts with chapters on the formation and characterization techniques of lipid bilayers under various physicochemical conditions followed by methodological investigations in the formation of Giant Vesicles/Liposomes. The role of physical parameters such as elasticity of membranes in protein functioning is highlighted in the next chapter. Given the current developments in science and technology, the field of simple lipid nanostructures has also evolved to embrace fascinating and complex architectures including bicontinuous and micellar cubic phases, which has been focussed in-depth for their formation, structural characterization, and applications. Further chapters cover the applications of lyotropic phases, for example, as templates for the formation of solid nanostructures and stabilizing them into hierarchically ordered lipid nanoparticles
